result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Robert Jensen

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Defendant Richard Robert Jensen in court.  Attorney David Gardner Casey in court for Richard Robert Jensen.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation; no victims appear at today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court informs the parties that if the Preliminary Hearing is contested that the parties will need to set this with the assigned Judge on a date other than the Preliminary Hearing dates. 

Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Casey.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion for Discovery. Filed by Atty Casey.
Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
 Do not operate Motor Vehicle unless absolutely sober. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
No contact with the victim.

1:39 PM Defendant Richard Robert Jensen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Taylor Soule  appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Operate Motor Vehicle w/o Owners Consent and OWI 2nd. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant  is not   eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
